title: Drawing, Set Design:  Net Drop for "A View from the Bridge, " for 1998 production, Neil Simon Theater, New York City, 1998
title_raw: Set Design:  Net Drop for "A View from the Bridge, " for 1998 production, Neil Simon Theater, New York City
medium: Collaged photocopies, black adhesive and cellophane tape, ascetate overlay, white marking pen, graphite on foam core board
markings: Stamped in black on paper affixed to lower edge, left of center:  DAVID GALLO/SCENIC DESIGN/630 9TH AVE #1205/NEW YORK CITY, 10036/ (212) 664-1341
inscribed: Inscribed in white marking pen, upper edge left:  NEIL SIMON THEATER; at lower right:  "A VIEW FROM THE BRIDGE" 98 [superscript 1]/DESIGN BY DAVID GALLO; at lower left:  1/2" = 1' - 0"/NET DROP; at lower edge, to left of center:  [arrow pointing left] 35' - 0"; to right of center:  35' - 0" [arrow pointing right]; at lower center:  LC.
description: Large ship "Queen Mary"  viewed head on looms in center with repeated tall black stelel cranes filling space to left and right of ship. Image is surrounded by white pen line.  According to inscription, full net drop was to be 70" across.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Set Design:  Net Drop for "A View from the Bridge, " for 1998 production, Neil Simon Theater, New York City, 1998. Collaged photocopies, black adhesive and cellophane tape, ascetate overlay, white marking pen, graphite on foam core board. 
Gift of David Gallo. 2000-60-1
